Caption: Figure 6: Arity three gates for nonzero even components.
Mention:
Proof. For the odd case (0; x; y; 0; z; 0; 0; t) consider Figure 5. Clearly if t 6= 0 the left-hand  gure
has standard signature (0; x; y; 0; z; 0; 0; t) and solves the problem. If t = 0 we use the right-hand
diagram.
For the even case (t; 0; 0; z; 0; y; x; 0) the signature of the left part of Figure 6 is (ax + by +
cz; 0; 0; z; 0; y; x; 0) and therefore solves the problem for all values of x; y; z; t by appropriate choice
of a; b; c, unless x = y = z = 0 and t 6= 0. In that exceptional case we use the right-hand diagram.
